title: Bayer, BASF Ordered to Pay $265 Million in Weedkiller Crop-Damage Suit
summary: Ruling in dicamba herbicide case comes as Bayer fights separate litigation over Roundup spray. A jury ruled against Bayer AG and BASF SE in a crop-damage case, awarding $265 million to a Missouri peach farmer who claimed the companies encouraged farmers to irresponsibly spray a hard-to-control weedkiller.

title: U.S. Seeks to Rally Wary Europeans Against China
summary: Beijing seeks to 'dominate Asia as pre-eminent global military power,' U.S. defense chief says. MUNICH-Defense Secretary Mark Esper told European allies in a speech Saturday the U.S. considers China a pre-eminent threat in its pursuit of an "advantage by any means and at any cost."

title: Zuckerberg Pitches How Facebook Should Be Regulated Over Content
summary: At a security conference in Munich, the CEO describes the social-media platform as something between a newspaper and a telecommunications company. MUNICH- Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said the social-media giant falls somewhere between a newspaper and a telecommunications company, in terms of responsibility for content, and should be regulated as such.

title: The Battle for Chewing Tobacco's Modern Cousin
summary: Swedish Match, a maker of oral nicotine pouches, is tobacco investors' favorite stock. Now bigger rivals are copying its strategy.. Big cigarette companies are latching on to oral nicotine pouches. That could mean trouble for the tobacco industry's top performer, Swedish Match .

title: The Winners and Losers of London's Winter Art Auctions
summary: Some blue-chip works sold for lower-than-expected prices, and a few didn't sell at all, but the news wasn't all bad for sellers. The blue-chip art market continues to shrink. Over the past two weeks, London's chief auction houses sold $522 million worth of impressionist, modern and contemporary art, down nearly a quarter from a similar round held a year earlier.

title: The President's Next Temptation
summary: CEOs still don't like Trumponomics as much as their employees do.. Business investment needs a great American comeback. Today brought more good news on consumer confidence and retail sales-but also a warning that CEOs still aren't as optimistic about the economy as their employees are. A new trade fight with Europe would not help.

title: The Economics of Freezing Your Eggs
summary: For women of a certain age, there are a lot of questions about timing and cost-but little clarity. I've been thinking about my eggs a lot lately.

title: Looking Back at Dresden
summary: Seventy-five years since Allied bombing raids on Dresden killed about 25,000 people, resentment lingers, providing fertile soil for far-right and anti-Muslim groups. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Wyoming Makes a Case for Coal
summary: Governor recognizes climate change but thinks research can make coal cleaner and keep it in demand. Wyoming Gov. Mark Gordon thinks climate change is an urgent problem, but he is also making a case to keep using one of his state's biggest resources: coal.

title: Esports Leagues Want Gamers to Root for the Home Team
summary: Call of Duty, Overwatch and NBA 2K teams see growth opportunities in hosting competitions in cities around the world. Tribalism has long been the backbone of sports, with fans embracing teams that represent their communities. Now, owners and investors behind teams in three nascent videogame leagues are banking on people forming similar bonds by attending matches in their home markets.

title: Some Democrats Have Momentum; Others Seek It
summary: After New Hampshire, Warren and Biden slip, while Sanders, Buttigieg and Klobuchar ascend. In the wake of the New Hampshire primary, the Democratic presidential field this past week divided into two distinct groups: those with momentum and those trying to get it back.

title: Kashmir, in Lockdown Limbo, Bristles at Delhi's Political Solution
summary: Resume Subscription. SRINAGAR, India-At the office of the National Conference, the oldest political party in Kashmir, the gates are locked, a lone security guard sitting outside. Its longtime rival, the Peoples Democratic Party, also shows little sign of life.

title: Connecticut Lawmakers Brace for Public Hearing on Vaccination Bill
summary: Public Health Committee pitches ban on nonmedical exemptions for childhood vaccinations. Connecticut lawmakers are gearing up for a potentially contentious public hearing about legislation that would eliminate religious exemptions for childhood vaccinations.

title: U.S. to Repatriate Some Americans From Coronavirus Cruise Ship
summary: Evacuees likely to fly to Travis Air Force Base in California, with some continuing to a base in Texas; fresh 14-day quarantines. The U.S. government is preparing to repatriate American citizens from aboard the Diamond Princess cruise ship, site of the biggest outbreak of the novel coronavirus outside China.

title: The Environmental Battle Over the Mexican Border Wall
summary: Resume Subscription. SONORAN DESERT, Ariz.-As President Trump pushes to speed construction of the Mexican border wall, both opponents of the wall and his administration are invoking the environment-one side to stop the barrier, and the other to build it.

title: This Anti-CEO's Mission Impossible: Use Capitalism to Kill Meat
summary: Impossible Foods founder Pat Brown wants to harness the free market to turn us all into vegetarians. Redwood City, Calif.-Capitalism's ultimate heroes were once the professional CEOs. Get an MBA; do time at P&G , GE , or IBM ; find a company that needs a turnaround artist, cost cutter or dealmaker. Glory went to those who scaled the corporate ladder.

title: The Astros Apologized for Cheating. Their Competitors Aren't Satisfied.
summary: As spring training opens, players are issuing a searing critique of both Houston's actions and MLB commissioner Rob Manfred's leniency. The Houston Astros' players received no punishment for their role in the sign-stealing scandal that continues to dominate the baseball world. MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred made sure of that by promising them immunity in exchange for honest testimony during the league's investigation of the cheating scheme.

title: Medicaid Standoff: Trump Plan to Tighten Oversight of States Draws Objections
summary: Administration proposal targets how states pay for Medicaid; governors and health-care companies say it threatens funding. Many governors, insurers and hospitals are denouncing a Trump administration plan to tighten oversight over how states pay for their share of Medicaid, saying it would deprive them of billions of dollars in funding, jeopardize health coverage and strain state budgets.

title: 'Proof: Photography in the Era of the Contact Sheet' Review: Mistakes and Masterpieces
summary: A selection of photographers' contact sheets lets visitors see into the minds of the artists, witnessing both failures and triumphs.. Cleveland

title: Selling Frozen Dumplings, Cutting Pay: Chinese Businesses Struggle to Survive Coronavirus
summary: Private businesses that make up a large and crucial part of the economy have been among the worst hit. As the fast-spreading coronavirus has damped sales, hurt worker productivity and halted operations at companies across China, private businesses that make up a large and crucial part of the economy have been among the worst hit.

title: Dealerships Give Car Buyers Some Advice: Just Stop Paying Your Loan
summary: Car sellers are telling hard-up borrowers to have their old cars voluntarily repossessed. Lenders and borrowers are losing out.. Joyce Parks was struggling to afford her Kia Soul when, she says, the dealership where she had bought it pitched her an unconventional idea: Stop making the payments.

title: Bloomberg Campaign Ad Touts Relationship With Obama, Despite Complicated History
summary: Former New York City mayor didn't endorse Obama in 2008 and withheld endorsement for most of 2012 race. In a multimillion-dollar TV campaign and on the trail, Michael Bloomberg portrays himself as having a close bond with former President Obama. But the two have had a complicated relationship, with Mr. Bloomberg at times criticizing the Obama administration.

title: The Ride-Hail Utopia That Got Stuck in Traffic
summary: Resume Subscription. Five years ago, Travis Kalanick was so confident that Uber Technologies Inc.'s rides would prompt people to leave their cars at home that he told a tech conference: "If every car in San Francisco was Ubered there would be no traffic."

title: What the Bible Taught Lincoln About America
summary: In wartime, a president who once seemed indifferent to religion evolved into a theologian of liberty.. When Abraham Lincoln was elected president in 1860, he was certainly not thought of as a man given to religious fervor. But over the next 4½ years, as hundreds of thousands of Americans died in the Civil War, the 16th president evolved into a theologian of the American idea, using the language and concepts of the Bible to reflect on the war's larger meaning. This year on Presidents Day, Americans will observe the 211th anniversary of Lincoln's birth. But in an age of declining biblical literacy, we are in danger of losing touch with a key source of his greatness.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Why You Might Need a Second Kitchen
summary: Does any home really need 1.5 kitchens? Absolutely, say those who've added a super-pantry, where the dirty work gets done.

title: Rise of Sanders, Trump Shows Decline in Party Power
summary: The national Republican and Democratic parties have far less sway now in anointing candidates and enforcing discipline. The winner of the most Democratic presidential votes so far often rejects the label of Democrat. The Republican president, who is seeking re-election, belonged to the GOP for only about half of the 20 years before he won the White House.

title: Motorola Razr vs. Samsung Galaxy Z Flip: The Flip Phone Is Back and It's Not a Total Flop
summary: Is the latest foldable phone trend a gimmick or a godsend? It could be a little of both.. Once upon a time, before dinosaurs and selfies, humankind carried a tool called the flip phone. Cave drawings depict these contraptions as being primarily for something called a phone call-it's akin to modern texting, only people used voices instead.

title: Rise in China Coronavirus Infections Raises Concerns
summary: Some public-health experts say outbreak's general trajectory nonetheless hasn't changed. BEIJING-Chinese authorities identified 5,090 new coronavirus cases, a new jump in their daily tally that has stirred concerns over the trajectory of the outbreak and raised fresh worries over whether China is offering an accurate appraisal of the epidemic's scope.

title: Fear and Boredom Aboard the Quarantined Coronavirus Cruise Ship
summary: U.S. State Department to evacuate Americans and their families aboard the Diamond Princess. TOKYO-The pools, hot tubs and bars of the Diamond Princess emptied out on Feb. 5, when authorities quarantined the luxury cruise ship at a Yokohama dock. Instead of overflowing buffets, staff in surgical masks deliver boxed meals and snacks, about 11,000 a day.

title: Trump Administration to Raise Tariffs on EU Aircraft
summary: With dispute over subsidies for plane makers like Airbus unresolved, the U.S. will impose a 15% tariff. The Trump administration said Friday it would increase tariffs on aircraft coming from the European Union, as its dispute with the bloc over subsidies for plane manufacturers remains unresolved.

title: Pentagon Shifts Stance on Sales to Huawei
summary: Defense Department drops opposition to tightening Chinese company's access to shipments from U.S. chip makers. The Pentagon has dropped its opposition to efforts within the Trump administration to make it harder for U.S. chip makers and other companies to supply China's Huawei Technologies Co. from their overseas facilities, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: SEC Seeks to Improve Speed, Quality of Stock Data Available to Public
summary: Proposal would reduce disparity in speed and quality between public feeds and private ones sold to higher-paying customers. WASHINGTON-Federal regulators launched a new effort to overhaul the plumbing of the U.S. equity markets with a measure to improve stock-price data available to the public and reduce the informational advantage enjoyed by some professional traders.

title: The Agony of the Democrats
summary: Bernie Sanders is riding the intellectual currents that the party and its elites have nurtured.. Bernie Sanders's victory in New Hampshire on top of his tie in Iowa makes him a favorite for the Democratic presidential nomination. Hard to believe, but in a winnable race against President Trump the opposition may nominate a socialist who wants the government to control energy production and health care, who wants nationwide rent control, and who calls America a "racist society from top to bottom." No wonder Democrats like James Carville are in agony.

title: Former Newsweek Executive Pleads Guilty to Fraud
summary: News organization was part of an alleged illegal scheme that obtained $35 million in financing. A former top executive at Newsweek's onetime parent company pleaded guilty Friday to state fraud and money-laundering charges for his role in a scheme to illegally obtain more than $35 million in financing, some of which went to keep the struggling news organization afloat.

title: Google Cuts Jobs at Cloud-Computing Group
summary: Reorganization is aimed at improving operations at the business. Google said it is cutting jobs at its cloud-computing unit as part of a reorganization aimed at improving operations at the business that has become more central to parent Alphabet Inc.
